definition: to mix/to mingle/muddled/to drift along/to muddle along/to pass for/to get along with sb/thoughtless/reckless
100 ml/one-tenth of a peck/measure for dry grain equal to one-tenth of sheng 升 or liter, or one-hundredth dou 斗
to close/to join/to fit/to be equal to/whole/together/round (in battle)/conjunction (astronomy)/1st note of pentatonic scale/old variant of 盒[he2]

sentences.english: When we have a mixture, and we're going to start with ideal gases.

sentences.english: Evenly divide the mixture, approximately 2 tablespoons per cup, among the muffin cups.
sentences.chinese: 平分混合物，大約每杯2勺，放在鬆餅杯裏。

sentences.chinese: 增加一半脫脂酸牛奶混合物攪拌，直到組合。

sentences.english: He fed the plant a mixture containing fish and  seaweed.
sentences.chinese: 他用一種含有魚類和海藻的混合物給植物施肥。

sentences.english: The rubber mixtures can be used for production of mouldings.

sentences.english: A mixture of milk and water is a insipid drink.

sentences.english: We can calculate our enthalpy of mixing.
sentences.chinese: 我們能計算混合物的焓。

sentences.english: The blood which circulates in our blood-vessels is a mixture of several substances .

sentences.english: A mixture of a metal with its sulfides, produced by smelting the sulfide ores of copper, lead, or nickel.

sentences.english: The mixture was agitated overnight on a magnetic stirrer at room temperature.
sentences.chinese: 一夜之間就被激動的混合物在室溫下磁力攪拌器。

sentences.english: Tianhuang stone. , a mixture of nacrite and dickite in varying proportions.

sentences.english: The reaction mixture was gravity filtered to remove unreacted material.
